passage_text: This work is based in the Oxford Institute for Energy Studies, Earth Sciences, Engineering, Chemistry, the Mathematical Institute, Politics and International Relations, Geography, and International Development.

This work is based in the Smith School of Enterprise and the Environment * , the Oxford Institute for Energy Studies, International Development, the Environmental Change Institute * , Engineering, Geography, Physics, and Politics and International Relations.

This work is based in Engineering, the Oxford Institute for Energy Studies, the Environmental Change Institute * , the Mathematical Institute, the Oxford e-Research Centre, and the Transport Studies Unit * .

Published: 28 th September 2015. By: OIES. This issue of the Oxford Energy Forum is dedicated to gas pricing. A mild 2013/14 winter in Europe and parts of Asia and a slowing of demand growth for LNG saw European hub prices and LNG spot prices begin to fall through the summer of 2014.

The Oxford Institute for Energy Studies (OIES), located in Oxford, United Kingdom, is a center for research into the economic and political areas of energy issues. The research focuses on: 1  the economics of petroleum, gas, coal, nuclear power, solar and renewable energy;
The Oxford Institute for Energy Studies specialises in advanced research into the economics and politics of international energy.
